statement.p: The half-life of caffeine in the human body is about 5.6 hours. A cup of coffee has about 120 mg of caffeine.

ol.li:
Write an equation for the amount of caffeine in a person's body after drinking a cup of coffee? Let C be the milligrams of caffeine in the body after t hours.
Preview Question 1 Part 1 of 3 Â

How much caffeine will remain after 10 hours?
mg
State your answer to the nearest hundredth of a mg.

How long until there are only 20 mg remaining?
hours
State your answer to the nearest hundredth of an hour.

The general half-life equation is \displaystyle{C}={C}_{{0}}\cdot{\left(\frac{{1}}{{2}}\right)}^{{\frac{{t}}{{{H}{L}}}}}.
In this case \displaystyle{C}={120}\cdot{\left(\frac{{1}}{{2}}\right)}^{{\frac{{t}}{{5.6}}}}

In \displaystyle{t}={10} hours there will be \displaystyle{C}={120}\cdot{\left(\frac{{1}}{{2}}\right)}^{{\frac{{10}}{{5.6}}}} mg.
Starting with 120 mg of caffeine and a half-life of 5.6 hours, this person's system will have about 34.8 mg after 10 hours.
